subject: Improve help text of scrubber opts

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(5 comments)

The new help text is very clear. Just a few suggestions inline.  (I apologize for being so picky, but these will be end user facing.)

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Did not want to flag each of them out individually. The "Services that consumes this:" section is IMO redundant on each of these texts and comes clear from the help body and the classification of the option.

While information is good, lets not clutter our already long and messy example configs with redundant info.
Uploaded patch set 3.

nit ques inline
Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

@Brian, while I do understand that uniformity is great and all but if we clutter all those fields to all of our config options we actually will provide wrong information to our users. We have quite a few options that are shared in code level, but not config wise. Stating in the config file that option X is consumed by some glance component that does not consume that config file would be just plain wrong. Also none of our current mechanisms allows separating those during the generation phase. So my vote goes for opting out of them everywhere rather than opting in and providing false info somewhere.

I also still don't like duplicating the allowed values where the config generator provides those by the option type (like ints and bools etc).

Please at minimum include the regenerated configs so we see the actual effects.

Patch Set 5: Verified-1
